instruction: Prednisone oral corticosteroid—continue the existing short course for COPD exacerbation relief; complete the remaining couple of days as previously prescribed (exact dosage per prior prescription), then stop.

attributes.note_to_pharmacist: Dispense exactly two (2) 5-mg prednisone tablets to allow the patient to finish the final 2 days of his taper; no additional refills.
attributes.sig: Take 1 tablet (5 mg) by mouth once each morning with food for 2 days, then stop the medication.

instruction: Tiotropium inhaler—maintenance bronchodilator for chronic COPD management; inhale one capsule (18 mcg) once daily via HandiHaler, ongoing.

attributes.note_to_pharmacist: Dispense ONE Spiriva Respimat inhaler (4 g solution/60 actuations). Each inhaler provides a 30-day supply when used as directed (2 puffs once daily).
attributes.sig: Inhale 2 puffs from the Spiriva Respimat inhaler by mouth once every day, at the same time each day, until the inhaler is empty (60 puffs total). Prime the inhaler before first use and if not used for more than 3 days. Rinse mouthpiece after use; do not swallow the mist.

instruction: Patient to finish the remaining prednisone doses, then continue only the tiotropium inhaler for maintenance and notify the provider if the jitteriness worsens or becomes bothersome.

attributes.comment: Finish the remaining prednisone doses, then continue only the tiotropium inhaler for maintenance, and notify the provider if the jitteriness worsens or becomes bothersome.
